description: Study of past human societies through material culture

description: Use of anthropological theories, methods, and insights to address contemporary social and cultural issues

description: Study of the economic systems and practices of different cultures and societies

name: Political Anthropology
description: Study of political systems and power relations in different cultures and societies

name: Psychological Anthropology
description: Study of the relationship between culture and the human mind and emotions

description: Study of ancient Egypt and its culture and artifacts

description: Study of the ancient civilizations of the Near East, including Mesopotamia, Egypt, and Persia

description: Study of the archaeology of the ancient Near East in relation to the Bible

description: Study of the material remains of societies that existed after the invention of writing

description: Study of submerged archaeological sites and artifacts

description: Management of archaeological sites and cultural resources for preservation and public use

name: Mass Communication
description: Study of communication that takes place through mass media, such as television, radio, newspapers, magazines, and the internet.

name: Interpersonal Communication
description: Study of communication that takes place between individuals, including verbal and nonverbal communication, listening, and feedback.

name: Organizational Communication
description: Study of communication in organizations, including communication between individuals, groups, and departments, and communication within hierarchies.

name: Intercultural Communication
description: Study of communication between individuals from different cultural backgrounds, including the role of culture, language, and social norms.

name: Health Communication
description: Study of communication in the context of health and healthcare, including doctor-patient communication, health campaigns, and health education.

name: Political Communication
description: Study of communication in the context of politics and public affairs, including political campaigns, media coverage of politics, and political propaganda.

name: Digital Communication
description: Study of communication in digital media, including social media, email, texting, and other forms of online communication.

name: Rhetoric
description: Study of the use of language to persuade and influence others, including the analysis of public speeches, debates, and other forms of public discourse.

name: Media Studies
description: Study of the cultural and social impact of mass media, including the analysis of media content, audience reception, and media effects.

name: Gender and Communication
description: Study of the role of gender in communication, including gender differences in communication styles, gender identity, and gender roles.

name: Performance Studies
description: Study of performance as a mode of communication, including the analysis of theater, dance, music, and other forms of live performance.

name: Critical Cultural Studies
description: Study of communication in the context of power relations and social justice, including the analysis of race, ethnicity, class, and gender in communication.

name: Fiction Writing
description: Creative writing that deals with imaginary events and people, often exploring the human condition through storytelling.

name: Poetry Writing
description: Creative writing that focuses on the art of language, utilizing poetic techniques to convey emotions, ideas, and images.

name: Playwriting
description: Creative writing that creates stories, characters, and dialogue intended to be performed on stage.

name: Screenwriting
description: Creative writing that creates stories, characters, and dialogue intended to be produced for film or television.

name: Creative Nonfiction Writing
description: Creative writing that uses literary techniques to convey factual information and/or personal experiences.

name: Memoir Writing
description: A sub-genre of creative nonfiction writing that is a personal account of the author's experiences or memories.

name: Autobiography Writing
description: A sub-genre of creative nonfiction writing that is a comprehensive and factual account of the author's life.

name: Travel Writing
description: Creative writing that involves accounts of the author's experiences and observations while traveling.

name: Nature Writing
description: Creative writing that focuses on nature and the environment, often with a scientific and descriptive approach.

name: Science Writing
description: Creative writing that conveys scientific concepts and ideas to a general audience in an engaging and accessible way.

name: Food Writing
description: Creative writing that explores the art and culture of food, including food history, culinary traditions, and personal experiences with food.

name: Humor Writing
description: Creative writing that uses wit, satire, and humor to comment on society or everyday life.

name: Satire Writing
description: Creative writing that uses humor, irony, and exaggeration to criticize and expose the follies and vices of society.

name: Children's Writing
description: Creative writing that is written for and marketed towards children, often including elements of fantasy, adventure, and whimsy.

name: Young Adult Writing
description: Creative writing that is written for and marketed towards young adults, often exploring themes of self-discovery, coming of age, and identity.

name: Writing for Digital Media
description: Creative writing that is designed for consumption on digital platforms, including blogs, websites, and social media.

name: Writing for Social Media
description: Creative writing that is specifically designed for social media platforms, such as Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram.

name: Metaethics
description: The study of the nature of ethical concepts, language, and thought. Metaethics aims to understand what ethical terms and concepts mean, how we come to acquire ethical knowledge, and how we can justify ethical claims.

name: Normative Ethics
description: The study of what actions are right or wrong, good or bad, and how we should live our lives. Normative ethics aims to develop and evaluate ethical theories and principles that guide moral decision-making.

name: Applied Ethics
description: The application of ethical theories and principles to specific issues or areas of life. Applied ethics includes subfields such as medical ethics, business ethics, environmental ethics, and others.

name: Descriptive Ethics
description: The study of people's beliefs, attitudes, and behavior regarding ethical issues. Descriptive ethics aims to describe and explain how people actually make moral decisions and judgments.

name: Moral Psychology
description: The study of how people develop and exercise their moral capacities, including moral reasoning, emotions, character, and motivation. Moral psychology aims to understand how these factors influence ethical decision-making and behavior.

name: Philosophy of Law
description: The study of the nature of law, legal systems, and legal reasoning. Philosophy of law aims to understand the foundations and principles of the legal system, including the relationship between law and morality.

name: Film theory
description: The study of the principles and concepts that underlie the creation and interpretation of film.

name: Film history
description: The study of the historical development of cinema and its cultural, social, and economic contexts.

name: Film aesthetics
description: The study of the formal and stylistic elements of film and their effects on the audience's perception and experience.

name: Film production
description: The study of the practical aspects of filmmaking, including pre-production, production, and post-production.

name: Cinematography
description: The study of the techniques and art of capturing images on film or digital media.

name: Sound design
description: The study of the creation and manipulation of sound in film, including sound effects, music, and dialogue.

name: Film criticism
description: The study of critical analysis and evaluation of films, including their artistic, cultural, and historical significance.

name: Genre studies
description: The study of different types of film genres, including their history, conventions, and themes.

name: Documentary film studies
description: The study of non-fiction films and their artistic, cultural, and social impact.

name: Animation studies
description: The study of animation techniques and aesthetics in film, including traditional animation, computer animation, and stop-motion animation.

name: Global cinema
description: The study of films produced outside of Hollywood and their cultural and social contexts.

name: Digital media
description: The study of the impact of digital technology on the production, distribution, and consumption of film.

name: Feminist Theory
description: Explores the ways in which gender intersects with other social categories such as race, class, and sexuality, and investigates the social, political, and cultural implications of these intersections.

name: Queer Theory
description: Examines the ways in which gender and sexuality intersect and how these intersections are constructed and represented in culture, history, and society.

name: Women's Studies
description: Explores the roles and experiences of women in various societies, with a focus on issues such as gender inequality, social and political empowerment, and representation.

name: Masculinity Studies
description: Explores the ways in which masculinity is constructed and performed in different cultures and societies, and how it intersects with other social categories such as race, class, and sexuality.

name: LGBTQ+ Studies
description: Examines the social, cultural, and political dimensions of lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and queer identities and communities, with a focus on issues such as discrimination, representation, and social movements.

name: Sexuality Studies
description: Explores the ways in which sexuality is constructed and represented in culture, history, and society, and how it intersects with other social categories such as gender, race, and class.

name: Intersex Studies
description: Examines the social and medical treatment of people born with intersex traits, as well as the experiences of people who identify as intersex.

name: Transgender Studies
description: Explores the social, cultural, and political dimensions of transgender identities and communities, with a focus on issues such as discrimination, representation, and social movements.

name: Two-Spirit Studies
description: Focuses on the experiences of Indigenous people who identify as Two-Spirit, a term used to describe gender and sexual diversity in Native American and First Nations cultures.

name: Broadcast Journalism
description: The reporting of news and current events through broadcast media such as television and radio

name: Data Journalism
description: The use of data analysis techniques to produce and report news stories

name: Investigative Journalism
description: In-depth reporting that uncovers scandals, corruption, and other societal issues

name: Multimedia Journalism
description: The use of different media formats such as text, images, video, and audio to tell news stories

name: Photojournalism
description: The use of photographs to tell news stories

name: Science Journalism
description: The reporting of scientific news and research findings

name: Sports Journalism
description: The reporting of news and events in the world of sports

name: War Journalism
description: The reporting of conflicts, wars, and related events and issues

name: Business Journalism
description: The reporting of news and analysis related to business and finance

name: Environmental Journalism
description: The reporting of news and analysis related to the environment, conservation, and sustainability

name: Opinion Journalism
description: The expression of personal opinions and perspectives on current events and issues

name: Political Journalism
description: The reporting of news and analysis related to politics and government

name: Entertainment Journalism
description: The reporting of news and analysis related to the entertainment industry, including movies, music, and television

name: International Journalism
description: The reporting of news and analysis related to events and issues in other countries and regions

name: Community Journalism
description: The reporting of news and events in a specific community or locality

name: Media Theory
description: Studies of the nature of media, how media is created and consumed, and the impact of media on society

name: Media Criticism
description: Analysis and evaluation of media content, including news, advertising, film, and television

name: Media History
description: Study of the historical development of media technologies and their impact on society

name: Media Ethics
description: Examination of the ethical considerations and responsibilities of media professionals

name: Media Effects
description: Study of the psychological and social effects of media on individuals and society

name: Media Production
description: Practical skills and techniques involved in producing media content, such as film, television, radio, and digital media

name: Media Management
description: Study of the business aspects of media, including marketing, finance, and organizational structure

name: Digital Media
description: Exploration of the creation and consumption of media in digital formats, including online content, social media, and video games

name: Advertising
description: Study of the principles and practices of advertising, including media planning, creative development, and audience targeting

name: Public Relations
description: Study of the principles and practices of public relations, including media relations, crisis management, and reputation management.

name: American Politics
description: Study of American political institutions and behavior, including the presidency, Congress, political parties, elections, public opinion, and political culture.

name: Comparative Politics
description: Comparative study of political systems and institutions across different countries and regions, including democratization, authoritarianism, and political economy.

name: International Relations
description: Study of interactions between nation-states and non-state actors, including diplomacy, foreign policy, security studies, international law, and global governance.

name: Political Theory
description: Exploration of political concepts and ideas, including democracy, justice, liberty, equality, and human rights.

name: Public Administration
description: Study of the organization, management, and implementation of public policies and programs, including bureaucracy, public management, and public policy analysis.

name: Public Law
description: Study of the role of law in politics and society, including constitutional law, administrative law, and the relationship between law and politics.

name: Public Opinion
description: Analysis of the attitudes and beliefs of the general public toward politics and public policy, including surveys, polling, and statistical analysis.

name: Public Policy
description: Study of the processes by which government decisions are made and implemented, including policy analysis, program evaluation, and policy implementation.

name: Political Methodology
description: Development and application of quantitative and qualitative research methods to the study of politics and political phenomena.

name: Political Economy
description: Study of the interplay between politics and economics, including issues such as economic development, inequality, and regulation.

name: Social Stratification
description: Studies how individuals and groups are positioned within a social hierarchy, and how this affects their life chances and opportunities.

name: Sociology of Culture
description: Explores the social meanings and practices of cultural phenomena such as art, music, literature, fashion, and media.

name: Sociology of Education
description: Examines the social structures and processes that shape education, including school systems, curriculum, pedagogy, and student outcomes.

name: Sociology of Health and Illness
description: Investigates the social factors that influence health, illness, and healthcare, including access to resources, social support, and cultural beliefs.

name: Sociology of Law
description: Explores how law is created, enforced, and contested within society, and how legal institutions shape social relations and norms.

name: Sociology of Religion
description: Examines the role of religion in society, including its impact on social values, identity, and behavior.

name: Sociology of Science and Technology
description: Studies the social and cultural factors that shape scientific and technological innovation, including the role of social institutions and actors in the development of science and technology.

name: Environmental Sociology
description: Examines the social and cultural dimensions of environmental problems and their solutions, including the role of social institutions, policies, and social movements in shaping environmental outcomes.

name: Economic Sociology
description: Studies how social structures and processes influence economic behavior and outcomes, including the distribution of resources, economic institutions, and the role of markets in society.

name: Political Sociology
description: Examines the relationship between social structures and political processes, including the role of power, institutions, and social movements in shaping political outcomes.

name: Sociology of Migration
description: Investigates the social and cultural dimensions of migration, including the causes and consequences of migration, and the social and cultural factors that shape the experiences of migrants and their reception in host societies.

name: Microeconomics
description: Focuses on individual economic agents such as consumers, producers, and markets

name: Macroeconomics
description: Studies the behavior of the economy as a whole, including economic growth, inflation, and unemployment

name: Econometrics
description: Applies statistical and mathematical methods to analyze economic data and test economic theories

name: Development Economics
description: Studies the economic development of countries and regions, and the factors that contribute to or hinder economic growth

name: International Economics
description: Examines the economic interactions between countries, including trade, finance, and migration

name: Public Economics
description: Analyzes the role of government in the economy, including taxation, public goods, and welfare programs

name: Environmental Economics
description: Studies the interactions between the economy and the environment, including issues related to pollution, natural resources, and climate change

name: Behavioral Economics
description: Examines how psychological factors influence economic decision-making, including topics such as biases, heuristics, and framing effects

name: Health Economics
description: Studies the production, consumption, and distribution of healthcare goods and services, including topics such as healthcare policy, healthcare markets, and healthcare financing

name: Labor Economics
description: Focuses on the labor market, including topics such as wages, employment, and discrimination

name: Industrial Organization
description: Studies the behavior of firms and industries, including issues such as market structure, competition, and regulation

name: Financial Economics
description: Analyzes financial markets and the behavior of financial agents, including topics such as asset pricing, corporate finance, and risk management

name: Agricultural Economics
description: Studies the economics of agriculture and the food industry, including issues related to production, distribution, and consumption of food

name: Urban Economics
description: Examines the economic aspects of urban areas, including topics such as urban growth, housing, and transportation

name: Law and Economics
description: Applies economic principles to analyze legal issues, including topics such as contracts, property rights, and torts

name: Economic History
description: Studies the economic development of societies over time, including topics such as economic growth, technological change, and institutional evolution
